tag_summary: Java is a popular programming language known for its portability, performance, and security features. It is widely used for developing web, mobile, and desktop applications, as well as enterprise software.

JavaScript is a dynamic scripting language used to create interactive web pages and applications. It is commonly used for frontend web development, as well as server-side programming and game development.

Python is a high-level programming language known for its simplicity, readability, and versatility. It is widely used for scientific computing, data analysis, artificial intelligence, and web development.
C# is an object-oriented programming language designed for building Windows applications, games, and web services. It is known for its performance, scalability, and ease of use.
C++ is a general-purpose programming language used for developing applications ranging from system software to high-performance games. It is known for its speed, efficiency, and low-level control.
Ruby is a dynamic, open-source programming language used for building web applications, automation scripts, and system utilities. It is known for its simplicity, readability, and expressive syntax.
PHP is a server-side scripting language used for creating dynamic web pages and web applications. It is widely used in web development, content management systems, and e-commerce platforms.
Swift is a powerful programming language used for developing iOS, macOS, watchOS, and tvOS applications. It is known for its speed, safety, and modern syntax.
Kotlin is a modern programming language used for developing Android apps, server-side applications, and web applications. It is known for its concise syntax, interoperability, and safety features.

Objective-C is a general-purpose, object-oriented programming language used primarily for developing macOS and iOS applications. It is known for its dynamic messaging system and support for legacy codebases.
Perl is a high-level programming language used for system administration, network programming, and web development. It is known for its powerful text processing capabilities and flexibility.

Rust is a systems programming language designed for performance, safety, and concurrency. It is commonly used for building web browsers, operatingsystems, game engines, and other performance-critical software.

Go is a programming language designed for building simple, efficient, and reliable software at scale. It is commonly used for building network and web services, cloud infrastructure, and command-line tools.

Scala is a modern, multi-paradigm programming language designed to express common programming patterns in a concise, elegant, and type-safe way. It is commonly used for building scalable, distributed systems and data processing pipelines.

Haskell is a purely functional programming language designed for building complex, high-performance software with strong static typing and advanced type inference. It is commonly used for building compilers, interpreters, and other performance-critical software.

Lua is a lightweight, embeddable scripting language designed for extending and customizing other software. It is commonly used in game development, embedded systems, and other applications where a lightweight and flexible scripting language is required.

TypeScript is a superset of JavaScript designed to add optional static typing, classes, and interfaces to the language. It is commonly used for building large-scale, complex web applications and libraries.
